info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Litchfield and southern Dutchess Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Newburgh, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Milford, Beacon, Pawling, Wappingers Falls, Kent, Fishkill, Hopewell Junction, Myers Corner, Wingdale, Dover Plains, Gaylordsville, Red Oaks Mill, East Fishkill, Beekman, Stormville, Baker Corner, Knapps Corner, South Dover, New Hamburg and Glenham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central New York.
